intro: Lastrea margaretae, commonly known as the Margaretae Lastrea, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems that store water. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the warmer months. Its leaves are typically reduced to scales, which help minimize water loss in arid environments. Lastrea margaretae is well-suited for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
